availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John H. Carr (Fayette County, Kentucky, clerk and notary public )

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, clerk and notary public. Harrison County, Kentucky, native. Married to Eliza J. McAlister Carr in Anderson County, Kentucky, on December 24, 1857. Father of Edgar Carr. Clerk in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1860. Clerk in the Quartermaster's Department in Fayette County in 1862. Notary public in Fayette County in 1862. Clerk in Fayette County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 2, p. 404.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, District 1, p. 313A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994027, Anderson County Marriages.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Fayette County, KY, July 1863, p. 8.
"John Howard Carr (1834-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #83656141, accessed December 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83656141.
KYR-0001-031-0066.
